review:
I want a sequel to Bulletstorm so fucking bad.

I loved this game as a kid back on 360 and played the shit out of it there, playing it again almost 10 years later and I love it even more than I did back then.

Skillshots are genuinely one of the coolest mechanics I've ever seen in a game, finding creative ways to take down enemies and getting rewarded for it is so fun and all the weapons in the game are all so unique and a joy to use.

The game art style wise still holds up very well and all the areas look great, especially on an OLED screen from my Steam Deck

The writing is ridiculous and over the top, usually I'd find it pretty cringe but I think it matches the tone of this game well enough to where I didn't really mind it much, it is also genuinely funny at points too.

This game was just so fucking fun. It is Insanely underrated.

review:
[h1][b]Капля удачи в море злоключений[/b][/h1]

Люблю шутеры в которых можно отключить мозг и наслаждаться отстрелом болванчиков – DooM, Serious Sam, Duke Nukem, Shadow Warrior, Painkiller..а вот эту игру я в свое время пропустил и попробовать ее попозже желание не возникало. И зря - игра оказалась на голову лучше Serious Sam 3 | Duke Nukem Forever, вышедших примерно в это же время.

➜ Графика. Ярко, сочно и приятно для глаз.
➜ Музыка. Под стать происходящему на экране, но особо никакие треки в душу не запали.
➜ Геймплей. Очень динамично и множество способов умертвить неприятеля. А еще эти способы можно комбинировать и выходит прям фееричное зрелище.
➜ Оружие. Его немного, но из всего очень приятно стрелять. Особенно понравилась снайперская винтовка и возможность управлять пулей.
➜ Сюжет. Для игры подобного плана он хорош.
➜ Юмор. Герои постоянно стебут друг друга. Планки как таковой нет – от безобидных приколов до шуток про мамку.

[h1] ➥[u] Итог.[/u][/h1] Я просто недоумеваю, как мог пропустить такой шедевр в момент выхода и игнорировать его так долго? Сейчас же, взяв его со скидкой в 95%, я невероятно доволен! Однозначно рекомендую к покупке!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987600149', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 834, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1711751606}
review:
There's something charming about [b]Bulletstorm's[/b] juvenile writing. It's uncomplicated, and very much inspired by the likes of Duke Nukem(which makes sense, seeing as how you can play good ol' Duke for fun). It's deliberately crass and violent. If it sounds like something a bunch of your dumb dudebro friends from high school would say in the late aughts, you can find similar in [b]Bulletstorm[/b]. 

Control-wise, it's a bit clunky and slow. Despite the cool idea behind the skill-kill-based system, you'll very quickly realize the best solution to 99% of the game's enemies is to kick them into the environment, and save your ammo for the few enemies that can't be grabbed and thrown, but there's fun in turning dozens of enemies into paste mindlessly.

Despite having fun with Bulletstorm, I have to give it a no for two reasons. One is that it has a [b]very[/b] aggressive head bob, that you cannot disable. The other is that the ending to the campaign is complete garbage and sequel bait that resolves nothing of the story(and most likely won't ever, since the game is now a decade+ old). Even on sale it's best to give this a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243589750', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 915, 'playtime_forever': 2271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2203, 'playtime_at_review': 2271, 'last_played': 1711675422}
review:
Tudo e mais um pouquinho sobre: Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition - "Me surpreendi, não  dava nada, agora eu sei  que ele vale o preço cheio aqui na Steam." (Valxb21) recomendo. 

Ah, a parte educacional de Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition pode não ser óbvia à primeira vista, mas há algumas lições valiosas que podem ser extraídas da loucura do jogo:

1. **Criatividade e Pensamento Rápido:** Para maximizar seus pontos e dominar o jogo, você precisa pensar fora da caixa e ser criativo em como derrotar seus inimigos. Isso incentiva os jogadores a desenvolverem habilidades de resolução de problemas e a pensar de forma estratégica, mesmo em situações caóticas.

2. **Trabalho em Equipe:** No modo multijogador cooperativo, aprender a trabalhar em equipe é essencial para sobreviver. Os jogadores precisam se comunicar, coordenar ataques e apoiar uns aos outros para enfrentar os desafios mais difíceis. Essa colaboração promove habilidades sociais e trabalho em equipe.

3. **Recompensas pela Criatividade:** Bulletstorm recompensa os jogadores por serem criativos e inovadores em seus métodos de jogo. Isso ensina os jogadores a buscar soluções não convencionais para problemas e a experimentar diferentes abordagens para alcançar seus objetivos.

4. **Gerenciamento de Recursos:** Com o sistema de pontos do jogo, os jogadores precisam tomar decisões estratégicas sobre como gastar seus recursos para maximizar seu potencial de combate. Isso ajuda a promover habilidades de gerenciamento de recursos e pensamento estratégico.

**História:**
- Imagine um bando de mercenários espaciais, com mais personalidade do que juízo, em uma jornada intergaláctica cheia de reviravoltas, tiroteios insanos e humor ácido. Bem-vindo ao universo de Bulletstorm!
- A trama segue Grayson Hunt e sua equipe enquanto eles navegam por planetas estranhos e perigosos, tentando sobreviver enquanto se envolvem em uma conspiração épica. É como se os mercenários de "Guardiões da Galáxia" tivessem um encontro caótico com "Mad Max".

**Modo Multijogador:**
- Sinta a adrenalina em um modo multijogador que coloca você e seus amigos em desafios de sobrevivência cooperativos, enquanto enfrentam hordas de inimigos com toda a insanidade característica do jogo.

**Jogabilidade:**
- Prepare-se para uma experiência de jogo que vai além do simples atirar e correr. Bulletstorm é tudo sobre estilo e criatividade. Use seu "Leash" para puxar inimigos e criar combos mortais e exageradamente brutais, rendendo pontos extras para gastar em melhorias e armas ainda mais ridículas.

**Conquistas:**
- Além de acabar com seus inimigos de maneiras espetaculares, Bulletstorm recompensa sua criatividade com um sistema de conquistas que incentiva a experimentação e a loucura. Desbloqueie troféus por explodir inimigos no ar, chutá-los em espinhos gigantes ou qualquer outra insanidade que você possa imaginar.

**Bugs:**
- Infelizmente, mesmo nos confins do espaço, alguns bugs conseguem encontrar seu caminho. Embora a maioria dos problemas técnicos tenha sido corrigida na edição "Full Clip", ainda pode haver alguns obstáculos inesperados pelo caminho.

**Parte Gráfica e Trilha Sonora:**
- Os gráficos de Bulletstorm são vibrantes e cheios de vida, com ambientes que vão desde ruínas alienígenas até paisagens desérticas e cidades futuristas. A trilha sonora combina perfeitamente com a ação, bombeando sua adrenalina enquanto você destrói seus inimigos com estilo.

**Tutorial e Legendas em Português:**
- Não se preocupe se você for novo no jogo, Bulletstorm oferece um tutorial útil para orientá-lo pelas mecânicas únicas de jogo. Além disso, para os falantes de português, há legendas disponíveis para uma experiência mais imersiva.

**Nota Final e Crítica:**
- Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition é uma montanha-russa de ação, com uma história maluca, jogabilidade viciante e personagens memoráveis. No entanto, alguns problemas técnicos podem prejudicar a experiência. No geral, eu daria a este jogo um sólido 8 de 10. Minha única crítica seria a falta de inovação em relação à versão original, mas se você está procurando por uma aventura selvagem e cheia de adrenalina, este é o jogo para você!

review:
tldr:
Good simple dumb fun. Wait for at least %50 imo but it's good

longer tldr:
I just finished my first run.  Overall it's fun and there are a lot of ways outside of just shooting to kill enemies. Played on normal and it wasn't to bad, I think I might of died like twice at most in a section and checkpoints are close enough so you never get setback to far. $40 might be a bit much, but like 20 or 10 is probably worth it (though of course lower is always better)

Gameplay:
There were a few on rail sections but I found them mostly enjoyable and they didn't overstay their welcome.  Once again check points aren't to far apart so if you die it's not to bad.  I did just use one gun for most of it (just for a fun "challenge") the other ones look cool, thought most damage you want to do will be environmental.  There's a point system and the more unique your kills the more points you get, and you can spend points on ammo and some upgrades, never really felt like I didn't have enough points so that's good.

Story:
Overall I actually enjoyed it.  While I'm sure other people might not like it or find it funny I thought it was good simple dumb fun.  Don't get the game for the story though

Game pace:
I felt like it ran for about a half to an hour longer than I would of liked, still good but some sections I just didn't liked.  Didn't really find any sections boring so it had a good pace.  Nothing really dragged out or felt like filler.

Bugs:
out side of some stutters near the end and sometimes button prompts to get over an object not showing up until I walked away and game back I didn't notice anything.  Nothing really that bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028881695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1710689479}
review:
Во времена древних богов, воителей и королей, простой народ искал защитника. Им стала Зена, королева воинов. 
Примерно в ту же пору я впервые запустил ремастированный Bulletstorm, и, скривив недовольную мину, тут же удалил, поскольку мне показалось, что слишком уж мыльная для ремастера картинка. Не надо такой быть. 
Шли годы, я возмужал и оперился, но всё так же верил в чудеса. 
Разочарованный отсутствием у каждого современного человека  персонального реактивного ранца, прав и свобод, я второй раз проходил Forgive me father, чтобы как-то отвлечься от несправедливости бытия. 
Но второй босс, постоянно защищаясь энергетическим щитом, выбесил меня настолько, что я удалил игру, и, чтобы как-то отомстить ублюдку, снова установил Bulletstorm Full Clip Edition. Теперь я понимаю, это не было взрослым поступком, а скорее представляло собой акт подростковой аутоагрессии. И мне очень стыдно, но сейчас не об этом. 
Краем глаза, в публикациях сообщества, я увидел пост о русской локализации Games Voice. Движимый любопытством, я установил и её, а запустив игру, обнаружил, что картинка не такая уж и мыльная, особенно, если полностью выключить параметр «шевелёнка». 
Куда занимательней оказался тот факт, что игра, мать её, просто шедевр. 
Судя по всему, вскормленный нечастыми бумершутерами, я научился ценить зубодробительный экшн и импакт, потому что такого удовольствия от стрелялки я не испытывал со времен Doom 2016 года. 
Вместе с тем, как бы крамольно это не звучало, Bulletshtorm для меня оказался притягательнее Doom, поскольку в нём есть великолепный сеттинг, изумительные персонажи, простой, но крепкий сценарий и, благодаря Games Voice, остроумная матерщина. 
Фактически, на протяжении 8 часов, я бегал посреди эпически красивого окружения, притягивал и пинал негодяев на шипы, отстреливая им головы в воздухе, и скармливая их плотоядным растениям, слушал как Иши и Тришка подшучивают над происходящим, не стесняясь в выражениях. Кто бы мог подумать, что лучшим бумершутером для меня в 2024 году окажется вовсе не бумершутер из 2011. Выкуси Forgive me father. 
А игра и правда просто шедевр. 
Я такого детского восторга не испытывал очень давно. 

Сегодня я многое понял. С возрастом мы меняемся, дорогие друзья. Есть в этом мире вещи, до которых нужно просто дорасти: зеленые оливки, Достоевский, Bulletshtorm Full Clip Edition. 
Я рад, что дорос, и я рад, что подростковая аутоагрессия привела меня в эту точку. 
Случайности не случайны. 

10 отстреленных херов из 10

review:
Ну это просто must-play игра, достойная, чтобы быть в коллекции. 

Хотя стрелять тут не то, чтобы очень весело (кому как, но большая часть оружия, особенно стандартный автомат, кажется каким-то игрушечным), управление немного ватное (вероятно, из-за того, что мультиплатформа), но развлечений хватает, можно весьма изощренно уничтожать врагов, используя хлыст, пинок и окружение. Но самое главное в этой игре - персонажи и их диалоги. Практически всё время с нами бегают напарники, все друг друга ненавидят и нещадно грязно и по-черному подшучивают. Не рекомендую играть на высоком уровне сложности - игра превращается в унылый шутер с укрытиями, и становится некогда отвлекаться на развлечения и диалоги, и постоянно не хватает боеприпасов. И вообще в игре весьма душные ачивки, есть мультиплеерные, так что руки опускаются проходить "на платину".

Крайне рекомендую игру ради ознакомления с персонажами, особенно Генералом Саррано, очень колоритный и запоминающийся злодей.

review:
It's loud, explosive and unbelievably stupid.

I love every second of its versatile action filled with comical levels of testosterone and adrenaline.

I mean, the guy can't even press a button to use an elevator. HE PUNCHES THE THING.

Aesthetically, in terms of style and sonically, it is a game that quite evokes a Gears of War vibe (Slightly more colorful), of foul-mouthed action heroes with harsh voices and no neck, blowing things up to the sound of bombastic symphonies and heavy metal.

The rhythm is considerably more fast-paced, intense and arcadey, with increasingly absurd set-pieces being poured out in an gratuitous but glorious way.

The story is very chaotic and has the best aggressive cliches in the world.

At that time there was nothing like it and it was a breath of fresh air amidst the abyss of military shooters. Hell, there's still nothing like it today.

It's a non-stop barrage of stupidity, which perhaps won't have much lasting appeal. But if you wallow in this kind of mindless, cathartic action and can laugh at bad jokes missing the mark by miles, welcome to the party.

Bulletstorm is straight to the point, absolutely insane and is spectacular.

P.S: You can shoot enemies' balls and get rewarded for it.

review:
Das ist ein Spiel, für nen 5er oder 10er. Cooles Konzept, dass bis zu 10 Stunden (mein Durchlauf waren 8 Stunden) Spaß macht.

Für alle, die früher die Veröffentlichung des Originalspiels verfolgt hatten: Dies hier ist die ungeschnittene Fassung und nicht das deutsche Original, welches zugrunde zensiert wurde, demnach wirklich auch spaßig. Die Grafik war auch damals schon veraltet. Diese Version sieht recht OK aus (aber veraltet) und frisst dafür nicht so viele Hardwareressourcen. Die Story ist zweckmäßig um den Spieler bei Laune zu halten. Gibt ein paar echt coole Witze und schöne Zitate, wenn man mit Gossensprache leben kann. Also ich musste manchmal schmunzeln.

Das Spiel hat einige kleine Bugs und gegen Ende ist es ein paar mal abgestürzt, aber nicht so schlimm wie bei heutigen Tripple A Spielen. Was mich gestört hat, war dass das Konzept nicht ganz schlüssig war. Man möchte zwar den Spieler ermutigen neue Spielweisen auszuprobieren, aber begrenzt die Munition und lässt gleichzeitig nur drei Waffen tragen. Ein bisschen verschenktes Potenzial. Wie in Deathspace ist der Stiefel mit Abstand die mächtigste Waffe. Was ich getreten habe gehört eigentlich in ein Museum. Gegner sind sonst recht starke Bulletsponges selbst auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad "Normal".

Für nen 5er bis 10er kann man nicht viel falsch machen und man kommt auf seinen Spaß.

review:
< Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition >

Nigdy wcześniej nie grałem w Bulletstorma. Dopiero w tę "odświeżoną wersję z wszystkimi DLC.
No prawie wszystkimi, bo jeden trzeba sobie dokupić.

Nic nie wnosi, żadnych nawet achivementów, ale jest spoko , zważywszy na Duke Nukema, bo to nim jesteśmy w dodatku.

Czym jest Bulletstorm w skrócie ?
To typowa "konsolowa" liniowa strzelanka z pierwszej osoby. Przypomina mi stare tytuły z giwerą na pół ekranu takie jak Serious Sam, Quake , Doom , Duke Nukem ;)
Jest pełni oskryptowana z ciekawym systemem nagradzania superstrzałów za wymyślne i efektowne zabójstwa.
 Fajne nazwy, typu gdy zabijemy gościa strzałem w gardło to leci napis "Głębokie Gardło"
Dostajemy za to coś na zasadzie punktów /expa/ kasy aby ulepszyć nasz śmiercionośny arsenał.
Jest brutalnie, jest soczyście , bronie też są spoko.

Plusy :
- Fabuła i Postaci z ciekawymi osobowościami
- Grafika , momentami bardzo ładne widoki
- Klimat [takie kosmiczne postapo]
- Bronie i ciekawe zabójstwa
- Brutalność , krew, flaki
- DLC z Duke Nukemem
- Dobry Voiceacting i przekleństwa
- Grę zrobili Polacy ;)

Minusy :
- Słaba muzyka [jak dla mnie]
- bardzo niski poziom trudności nawet na najwyższym poziomie
- nie można skakać [ tylko tam gdzie skrypt na to pozwoli]
- w oskryptowanych scenach, czy ślizgach , czy kopniakach widać nogi, ale podczas zwykłego poruszania się już nie...?


Moim zdaniem średniak do ogrania na raz, ewentualnie wbicia platyny ale nie ma po co wracać.
Polecam głównie fanom gier na odmóżdżenie się, Polskich gier i niezbyt wymagających soczystych strzelanek .

review:
[h1]Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition ist der beste und spaßigste Shooter den es gibt![/h1]

In Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition kämpft man sich auf dem Rachezug durch sehr viele Gegner und kann viele Möglichkeiten nutzen, sie zu erledigen. Je kreativer desto mehr Punkte gibt es,  um damit Munition oder Waffenverbesserungen zu kaufen. 

Die Grafik ist in ultra HD gestochen scharf und wunderschön.  Die Welten sind richtig schön gestaltet und bei den Tötungen fließt viel ,,Kirschsaft'', also ist das Spiel in Deutschland ungeschnitten,  was bei uns ein großes Glück ist.

Der Sound ist auch bombastisch,  die Musik passt zu den Szenen und die Soundeffekte sind genial. 

Jedoch sind die Errungenschaften zwar nicht sehr schwer,  aber teils fehlerhaft oder haben mit Glück zutun und man muss sich darauf verlassen, dass das Spiel nicht abstürzt... .
Bei mir hat eine Echo-Errungenschaft nicht gezählt,  weil ein Level diese nicht getriggert hat. Erst beim zweiten erspielen eines Levels wurde diese freigeschaltet. Ich hatte Glück, das es beim dritten Echolevel war.

Bei einem Freund ist das Spiel in Welle 20 abgestürzt, vor der Errungenschaft 40.000 Punkte im Online-Modus, wie frustrierend ist das bitte. Über 1 Stunde umsonst gespielt. 

Wenn diese Fehler nicht wären,  wäre das Spiel so perfekt,  so ist es nur sehr gut.

Ich habe das Spiel im Angebot gekauft. 

Wer etwas Glück für alle Errungenschaften in Kauf nehmen möchte,  empfehle ich das Spiel!

review:
Bulletstorm: Full Throttle is essentially a journey on an emotional rollercoaster, delivering more excitement than most shooter games. The game received its second refreshed version for new platforms, expanding the pool of players who can experience this exceptional ride.

Originally released in 2011, Bulletstorm still maintains its unique charm and charisma, which are impossible to forget. The Full Throttle version includes all the original game elements, along with additional graphical and technical enhancements that add new shine to these wild adventures.

The most distinctive aspect of Bulletstorm is its unique gameplay system, which rewards players for creative and spectacular ways of eliminating enemies. Instead of relying solely on accurate shots, the player is encouraged to use the environment and special skills like "Leash" or "Thumper" to achieve maximum points. It's a fresh approach to the shooter genre, bringing lots of fun and satisfaction.

The game world is as colorful as the characters we control. A furious blend of humor, brutal action, and crazy sci-fi makes Bulletstorm: Full Throttle a true audio-visual experience. The dialogues are full of sarcasm and witty remarks, making the adventure even more enjoyable.

The remarkable sound design cannot be forgotten either, adding another dimension to the gameplay. Explosions, gunfire, and enemy screams merge into an energetic symphony of chaos that keeps the player on the edge of their seat throughout the game.

review:
Scratches the itch for an on-the-rails first person shooter perfectly! I usually play open world sandboxes and infinitely replayable stealth games but after playing them for extended periods, I require a palette-cleanser and this game did exactly that. Very reminiscent of the typical Unreal Engine games from this era. It's like Crysis: Warhead and Gears of War had a baby. Big explosions, scenic set pieces, "colorful language" that would even make Saints Row games blush, serviceable plot and a mechanic that incentivizes being creative in killing things by chaining moves and trying different combos make this a great one-time play. I got it for dirt cheap at 90% off so it was good, mindless fun for 9 hours! The graphics hold up surprisingly well too and really served my hunger for a Gears of War game (Marcus Fenix-era one, not the modern ones) that we still don't have access to on the PC for who knows what senseless reason. But hey, if they gimme a Bulletstorm 2 anytime soon, I'd take that as well.

PS: I don't know why people praise Titanfall 2's level design when Bulletstorm also has quite a few similar levels up it's sleeve. This is the real underrated game when it comes to that.

review:
Terk edilmiş bir gezegene mecburi olarak ayak basmanın ardından Grayson Hunt, intikam almak ya da hayatta kalmak arasında zor bir seçim yapmak zorunda kalır. Suikastçı grubu Dead Echo'nun sürgüne gönderilmiş bir üyesi olan ve intikam ateşiyle yanan Grayson, kendisine ihanet eden komutanla yüz yüze geleceği ya da ekibinin gezegenden canlı olarak kurtulmasını sağlayacağı Stygia'da ekibini sahile vurmuş olarak bulur.

Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition, mevcut eklentilerini ve ilave olarak Full Clip'e özel tamamen yeni içerikleri barındıran tam bir Bulletstorm deneyimidir!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037679126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1705627325}
review:
Some may see that as an insult but i believe Bulletstorm is the closest you would get to an arcade rail shooter in FPS format and i think more series should try its approach. 

Its not the longest game and it certainly has its flaws here and there but it is a really enjoyable and bombastic ride from start to end with amazing set pieces and really fun and unique combat scenarios. 

My main drawback is that i wish it didnt work on a cover to heal system, but then again this game was ages before doom 2016 and for what it is, it is a short ride that makes the most of every moment with high octane action. (Not to mention its fantastic weapon, sound design, soundtrack and some of the views are just beautiful even for today's standatds imo)

I think the best way to describe this is if a AAA company were to do a Serious Sam game around the 360/ps3 and it actually turned out pretty well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046807512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1706308678}
review:
Divertente, caciarone, tamarrissimo MA, c'è un ma, anzi più di uno.
Per essere un FPS del 2011 è invecchiato benino nella grafica, almeno quella degli scenari. Il gunplay ha alcune buone idee ma non si evolve abbastanza nel corso della campagna.
Il guaio è che si tratta quasi di un FPS su binari, ovvero si prosegue dritti di zona in zona senza grande libertà d'azione: si entra in un'area, si pulisce dai nemici e si va oltre.
Le soluzioni di gameplay sono meno di quante sembrino all'inizio. Il divertimento è dato dalle combo nelle uccisioni, da realizzare combinando armi, mosse corpo a corpo (calcio, scivolata, cappio) ed elementi ambientali.
Alla lunga è risultato meno divertente di quanto prometteva, anche perché un FPS con zone così circoscritte e SENZA SALTO (esatto, non si può saltare, siete inchiodati al suolo) è dannatamente limitante.
A questo aggiungiamo una trama pezzente banalissima di cui non ci frega nulla, personaggi che sono macchiette e ce li portiamo appresso senza un vero perché: non possiamo dar loro ordini in battaglia, non c'è lo straccio di una co-op in campagna (che sarebbe stata graditissima).

Tanto sano caos, ma anche una limitatezza nel gameplay che non mi aspettavo.
Divertente a tratti, da amante degli FPS splatter l'ho apprezzato, ma ha una rigiocabilità scarsa se non inesistente.
Voto 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198257036119', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1705177227}
review:
Bulletstorm is an edgy thrill ride from the start to finish with buckets of blood, dump trucks of gore, lots of colourful language, a healthy dose of dark humour, and a story driven by personal revenge paired with a sense of moral righteousness. Oh, and it is violently fun and addicting to play, especially once you get a hang of the mechanics.

The tale follows Grayson Hunt and his team, Dead Echo, on the run from their former General Sarrano who used them to further his political career by making them murder countless innocent civilians. Disgruntled at what they had become, they decided to go their own way and make Sarrano pay for the atrocities that he had committed against humanity. Fueled by this rage, in his drunken thirst for revenge, Hunt takes Sarrano down with his own ship upon a chance encounter in the orbit of a random planet and ends up crashing right alongside Sarrano on the very same planet, stranded and with his crew mostly deceased.

While the above may sound like a bunch of spoilers, it's just the Prologue to the campaign that you get to see for yourself in the first 20 minutes of the game. The real game itself begins once you're on the planet and plays out more like a drama that rocks to and fro with the tide with far and few plot points in between. The focus of the game lies more in the thrill of the rush that is the violent combat and the plethora of creative ways in which you can kill your enemies than it is concerning the story. When it comes to the story itself, it'll blow right past you at the very beginning of the game, and the rest of it is you blowing up bad guys right up until the end where you're teased with a sequel after the credits. That being said, there is a good play on the moral dilemma that Hunt faces throughout the game and how his actions constantly weigh against him as he balances his personal desires for vengeance while measuring the practical need to keep Sarrano alive for the time being.

Speaking of blowing up bad guys, the game does a fine job of giving you as many options as you could ask for. It's mostly about using the tools you have at your disposal to lay waste to as many enemies as efficiently as you can while being as stylish as you can. You're actually awarded more points for getting more creative with your kills and these points, in turn, let you upgrade your weapons and buy more ammo for the same. Things such as kicking your enemies off cliffs and building edges or into water, re-bar, cacti, or even exposed electrical hazards give you extra points. The use of environmental hazards such as exploding barrels has been taken to the next level through various creative effects and is highly encouraged. The worplay associated with these Skillshots ranges from witty to bordering on the obscene. If anything, the game is quite edgy to say the least. The flow of the gameplay itself keeps switching between outright carnage, cutscenes, and loading sequences masked by the use of long elevator rides and lengthy crawlspaces and empty sections. That being said, it all manages to blend together very seamlessly.

You also have a whip to pull enemies closer to you and your legs to kick them back where they came from. Or onto a cactus if that's where you prefer them. You can do the same with environmental hazards as well and it's all a grand thrill, really. The weapons tie in exceptionally well with the gameplay, and I'd personally say that Bulletstorm did a good job of integrating the most important aspect of an FPS with the FPS itself.

Now, the Full Clip Edition is supposed to be the remastered version and it is quite visually striking, even if the graphics are reminiscent of the old, shiny, blurry Unreal Engine 3 era. While I won't compare to it modern games where its practically impossible to tell whether it is a game or something shot on a film reel anymore, the backdrops and atmospheres are excellently made for the most part. Even though the game is quite linear, it has excellent art direction and makes me feel like I could've sat back and enjoyed the views in which they landed had it not been a war-torn battlefield. There isn't too much detail. Just enough to deliver the shock of brutality and the serene beauty of what used to be planet resort. There were even a few scenes that made my potato PC cry because they had too much lighting for it to handle, and I must admit, they were glorious.

Moving on the sound design, the game has a very thrilling soundtrack that's both optimistic and ominous at the same time. And I believe that the soundtrack is perhaps part of the sound design, all things considered. Ignoring the dialogue delivery which is a goldmine of humour in its own right, the second best thing would be the sounds of all the weapons that you get to fire and the related sounds that you character makes every time Hunt moves or kicks something or even whips something. But that's about it. Unfortunately, the sound design for the actual gameplay itself could ask for improvement and especially in the sound stage department. There is practically no depth to the sound and all sounds sound the same for the most part. It's practically impossible to tell where you're being shot from by the sound and it's a problem only exacerbated with the lack of visual hit indicators. One problem I've frequently faced is not realising when a melee enemy is right next to me, eating away at my health while I'm busy shooting his compatriots' heads off. It doesn't pose a game-breaking issue in most cases, but it is certainly one of the departments that could use an upgrade.

There are a few other issues with the game that I had faced. The primary issue comes by way of level design and how there are so many things in the level to physically block you. Sometimes, these are crawlspaces that haven't been scaled properly and you can't enter them unless you're at the right point and sometimes, these are random bits of the wall poking out to keep you from sliding or even moving forward unless you move a bit to the side to clear them. These elements that I'm talking about hardly count for cover. They're just a consequence of poor implementation of colliders that constantly get in the way of the movement of your character. There have also been countless times when my own teammates have decided to betray me by becoming meat shields for the enemies and eat up all my bullets or redirect hazards I'm tossing at them by outright going out of their way to get into mine. There have also been instances where I've almost died because I'm pinned by a poorly implemented wall on one side and Ishi on the other. Not only that, there have two different instances of bug regarding Ishi as well. One was where he didn't load in at all and I couldn't progress past a certain part of Level 2-2 because he was required to activate a switch for me to use. The second came by way of Ishi getting stuck atop a chair like a homeless man in level 5-1 instead of coming to the monorail like he was scripted to and causing the cutscene to not load. In the first instance, exiting the chapter and reloading it did the trick and in the second, I just had to wait for a while for him to warp to my side. So while they were bugs, they weren't anything game breaking. My primary complain is still the colliders in the level design that cause you to get stuck.

All in all, Bulletstorm is one roller coaster of a thrill ride that is not only worth playing, but also replaying. Its main appeal comes by way of the vast ways to kill your opponents in style and the fast, dizzying pace of it all. Almost everything blends together seamlessly well and while the sound design and level design could use a bit of work, it is still a blast as long as you don't really expect much by way of plot and are mostly satisfied with the drama and humour of it all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984015006', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1704109791}
review:
I will not sugar coat this review at all: This game sucks.

I have never played an action game with so many cut scenes and forced walking areas in my life. The game is also chapter based and that really breaks the immersion factor. The graphics are ok but the map design is not. The map design is pure nonsense of what feels like early 90's map design diarrhea. 

The overkill skill point system is the most interesting thing about this game and it could not keep my interest. The NPC dialog is horribly written and acted and is extremely cringey hearing them try too hard to be edgy.

This game will appeal to two groups of people tweens and those that grew up playing this as one of their first games. Nostalgia can elevate a game pretty far and often have someone rate a game higher than it deserves.

On a scale of 1 to 10 I would rate it a 5 since it does not appear to be buggy but does not appear to be good either.

review:
There are things this game doesn't have like a lot of story but what it does have is: fun.
I already played it like, 12 years ago? on a pirate copy and I saw it on sale now and thought "yeah why the heck not?" I wanted to see if it was as much fun as I remembered it to be and it delivered.
This game is pre-woke pre-sweet baby era so what you get is an unsanitized, gory, and fun game.
It's one big rush and it can be beaten in one sitting. 
Best played with the Duke Nukem DLC because his oneliners and presence are as stupid but therefore hilarious as ever before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262626587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1703460371}
review:
What is Bulletstorm ?

Before I start this review, I'll say to ignore my playtime, I bought the original bulletstorm version here on steam, the one that had the crappy GFWL integration and played it a lot,  however it was taken out of steam years ago and because of that I was never able to play this game's multiplayer or give it a review it deserved, so I got the full clip edition recently as it looks like to be better without GFWL and seems to be more modernized and was discounted, so here we go.

I'm gonna be brief bulletstorm is definitely one of my go-to recommendation for people looking for a bombastic singleplayer campaign experience, not only they have a diverse selection of weapons the game just never stops, at every chapter it introduces something cool or a nice setpiece, either through a bossfight or simply pulling something crazy out of nowhere like controlling a remote monster to attack your targets or running away from a kaiju while a city is falling apart or simply trying to avoid getting hit by a giant spining wheel that keeps chasing you, the game never loses momentum, I also really like the art design here, the game takes place in some weird planet that has a very distinct architecture which makes every level look unique.

When talking about story, bulletstorm may have a stupid story with dumb characters and it knows it, it has this whole explosion-filled blockbuster movie aspect all around it but because of that its fun, with the diverse set of weapons you can use and the amazing shockwhip that the game gives you to pull enemies that you can kick or creatively kill it gives the game a similar gameplay feel of games like the new doom or shadow warrior 3 which I love, here in this remastered version you can also play the multiplayer which is decent, however Im not really sure if this remaster is overall a big visual upgrade over the original but without GFWL playing it is much easier and less headache-inducing. Considering how cheap this game is and how fun it is to play, I'd say for an campaign that you will take around 8 hours to finish and the game's other modes make it a worthy pick if  youre fan of this type of fps experiences, the ones that just want to go crazy and say f*ck realism which is something I wish every fps game would do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080838768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1703453480}
review:
I remember first seeing this game in the Official Xbox Magazine around 2010. The magazine featured a glowing review of Bulletstorm, and having finally played it many years later I can confirm that I found it rather enjoyable. 

The weapons are diverse and all fun to use (quad barrelled shotguns, drill launchers, steerable explosive bullets). The gore never fails to amuse; splatting an enemy against a giant cactus never gets old. As someone who usually gets quickly bored of gratuitous violence, I will say that with this game the magic doesn't fade and blowing people apart remains fun all the way through. The graphics have in my opinion aged very well too. I would rather there had been less quick time events, but what can you really expect from a game from that era? I would say that Bulletstorm was definitely overlooked at the time, seeing as people ignored the innovative skillshot system of this game in favour of the generic military first-person shooter at the time.

One thing I was less keen on and thought might ruin the game for me is the rudeness. There is a lot of explicit language; something I usually find to be overused, unnecessary and tiresome. But to be honest, here it was just so over the top and bombastic that in a way its almost charming so I'll can overlook this.

This edition of Bulletstorm is a re-release but apparently the graphics barely changed, and there's a Duke Nukem DLC (which should have been free). I would definitely not recommend this game for full price seeing as it often goes on sale for 90% off (which is a bargain). Overall, Bulletstorm is an action-packed experience that I would definitely recommend if you're looking for a high octane game which doesn't take itself seriously, and that can be completed in a few short play sessions.

review:
Overall it's a really neat remaster to play with keyboard and mouse, but it's barely playable with a gamepad. I don't think it's an issue on developer's end though, cause Steam tend to throw a banner "full gamepad support" left and right, and lots of games with such banner only provide partial support, and Bulletstorm is no exception.

So, lets see what does "full gamepad support" mean in Bulletstorm:

- You have four predetermined layouts (non of which I find particularily comfortable) to choose from and no ability to remap anything
- No options for sensitivity, deadzones or acceleration for sticks
- No options to calibrate sensitivity differences between standard shooting, aiming down sites, using heavy weapons and steering sniper rifle bullets either

So you are basically stuck with lots of predetermined parameters that cannot be changed. I recommend this game overall, but I strongly don't recommend it for anyone who seeks smooth and pleasant experience with a gamepad.

review:
Me lo he pasado muy bien con este juego por las siguientes razones:
- La duración no es mucha pero está muy bien concentrada ya que te sientes en frenesí constantemente.
- Los escenarios con los paisajes que ofrecen son de lo mejor que he visto para un juego tan antiguo.
- Las armas son bastante originales y divertidas de usar, tienen mucha esencia del Duke Nukem o del Doom.
-A diferencia de otros shoters en primera persona en que lo único que hacías era pasar del punto A al punto B disparando cual pollo sin cabeza, en este te recompensan por ser todo lo creativo que quieras con las muertes de los enemigos.
 Sí que es verdad que hay dos puntos negativos que me gustaría resaltar que aunque no me hayan sacado mucho de la experiencia, sí que es verdad que me molestaron un poco:
- Hay varios fallos o bugs en ciertas zonas del juego; una de ellos fue en una de las escenas finales donde el protagonista discute con uno de sus compañeros, en mi caso ni si quiera habló, solamente gesticuló movimientos mientras que los demás lo observaban fijamente, aunque fue bastante gracioso de ver.
- En un momento de la partida tomas el control de un robot, si bien las intenciones eran muy divertidas, el control del robot fue de lo más tedioso en todo el juego debido a que la interfaz con la que apuntas es casi imposible darle a los helicópteros que vienen, por no mencionar que al pasar al control de dicho robot, el juego impide que des patadas o te deslices, siendo esto una sentencia a muerte si te tomas con un enemigo de frente.
Por lo demás es casi perfecto y puedo decir confianza que se ha vuelto de mis juegos favoritos.

Однозначно рекомендую данный шедевр, за 5 часов прошел игру на нормальном уровне сложности.

author: {'steamid': '76561199487654486', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1701721454}
review:
I am not big on FPS or gore (played without gore), I didn't play the original release of the game, I was just looking for a bit of absolutely mindless fun after playing several puzzle games, and Bulletstorm (deeply discounted) gently provided it.

There is one bug that apparently hit a lot of people: sometimes the NPCs get stuck, and you have to restart the chapter. It hit me twice, was annoying each time, but luckily that wasn't on the harder parts of the campaign.

Story is run-of-the-mill late night space marine made-for-TV script, but with better special effects (and actors made of triangles). Voice acting is pretty good, especially the ridiculously over-the-top villain. Everything is over-the-top here. There is a variety of environments, which is nice.

The gameplay pushes you to try alternative ways of killing foes, by rewarding with extra points that you later need to buy ammo at refill points (there are many in the game, at least in normal mode). You can run out of ammo, and I'm not sure what you could do then, besides restart the chapter or the entire game. Deciding what you should buy (ammo and weapon upgrades) is part of the gameplay, not my favourite, but there aren't that many options, so you'll quickly find out what is useful or not.

Recommended, maybe not at full price.

review:
The 'meh' dialogue is 'meh' (but, admittedly, made me chuckle a few times with the creative insults they came up with) and the story is 'whatever' but neither of those matter when the combat game play is the focus and they nailed it. This game is a good time. Beat it in nearly 1 sitting because it is fast paced, keeps you wanting more, a lot of fun and I kept thinking the entire time "do I like this more than Gears of War" and.......I think I did. 

Also, shout out to the Voice Actor for Serrano, he did a fantastic job on that character! The others were very cliche but this VOA went hard on Serrano and you loved to hate him. What a character. 

Highly recommend this game if you want a fast paced, run and gun with interesting mechanics, no 'cover fire' mechanic necessary just shoot the crap outta everything and mix and match weapons to make fun combos. Overall, a very good time. Loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061128125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1701083927}
review:
Campaign is passable. 2010's AAA environments with tropes of that era. Turret sections, insane bloom, Quick Time Events etc. I dropped this game as a teenager because I found the main character to be insufferable. I was able to get through as an adult, but the plot is still somewhat childish. The main character is shockingly impotent and misses every opportunity to kill the big bad. Trick shots and combos are cool and are really the only thing the game has going for it. You will get stuck on geometry, you will have to restart checkpoints because your companion despawned from the world. In one of the final cutscenes the main character's dialogue and audio was completely missing so he was emoting without lipflaps even. Gamers who are unfamiliar with scripting bugs may lose minutes in confusion about the next step when the game is softlocked and they must load the most recent checkpoint.

- There is a mechanic with the sniper where the camera follows the bullet and you must steer the bullet so it hits its target. But the enemies will attempt to juke EVERY time you shoot the sniper at them. Not only is it dumb how slow the bullet would have to be, this totally slows down sniping to drugery when it could be a blast. IMO the "steer the bullet" minigame shouldn't happen every single sniper shot.

- The shotgun alt fire completely destroys every arena and can even pay for itself.

- There is an enemy time that will sit still but still be "too fast" for your grapple or kick. With the only interesting elements of gamplay removed, you must shoot them.

- Dominant strategy sorta ruins the variety of the game. In most arena's spam kicking enemies into instant death is the fastest strat. I was perma kicking almost every enemy until the last stretch of the game.

- Voice acting cast is pretty phenomenal, especially if you dislike this sort of script. Brought some life into the main cast even when their actions are stupid.

- Set pieces and multiple different environments is the highlight for me. Even with these graphics and art style, each section feels visually distinct which carries the game massively. Progressing through the game feels fresh because of all the variety, you love to see it.

- There's about twenty fps titles you should play before this one, but it's relatively palatable and a relic from the era in which large fps titled dared to be innovative.

review:
White men cannot jump. You literally cannot jump in this game. And game itself was bad at start and with time it just got worse.
Thanks to the 7th generation of consoles late 00s and first half of 2010s was dark age of gaming. Tons of garbage games like Bulletstorm, Singularity, Call of Duty, flooded gaming market (back when Far Cry wasn't pure garbage and at least we go Blood Dragon in 2012).
Almost every FPS was UE3-based bloomy mess. Graphics were decent, but could be better (Crysis 2 was already out). And what really was bad about graphics is that settings are "Graphics ON and OFF". Why? Because consoles.
Every game was trying to be like Call of Duty, which wasn't great itself, and gameplay was sh1tty just like that: tons of QTE (i.e tap SPACE to open the door), tons of scripted scenes and cutscenes, hints like "shoot to shoot", uberlinear maps and so on.
Intro's dragged but simply could be done as prerendered movie or a cutscene, but instead you have this: cutscene goes on, then you have to click RMB, then cutscene continues, then you click LMB... man, this is pure console experience which made people hate on consoles back then and hate all crossplatform games. And this is why you'll drop the game in 10-20 minutes or so. Get it on sale for collection and forget about it
==============================
Белые не умеют прыгать. В игре буквально нельзя прыгать. Сама игра на старте уже была хламом. А со временем ощущения от нее еще хуже.
Спасибо 7 поколению консолей, из-за которых конец 00-х и первая половина 10-х годов была темной эрой гейминга. Тьма убогих игр типа Bulletstorm, Singularity, Call of Duty заполонила рынок игр.
Почти каждый FPS был сделан на UE3 c этим самым убогим блумом. Графика сойдет, но могла бы быть лучше. И что реально печально было, что настройки графики были в духе "Графика ВКЛ/ВЫКЛ". Почему? Потому что консоли.
Много игр пытались походить на Call of Duty, которая сама по себе была не очень, и геймлей был вот таким говенным: тьма QTE (например, прокликай ПРОБЕЛ, чтобы открыть дверь), тьма скриптованных сцен и просто катсцен, подсказки в духе "стреляй, чтобы стрелять", дико линейные карты и так далее.
Вступление затянуто, хотя его можно было бы заменить пререндеренным кинцом или катсценой, но в итоге вы имеете подобное: пошла катсцена, потом нужно ткнуть ПКМ, катсцена продолжилась, потом нужно ткнуть ЛКМ... блин, это просто чистейшие консольные впечатления, которые заставили людей ненавидеть консоли и кроссплатформенные игры. Из-за этого вы забросите игру через 10-20 минут. Купите на распродаже для коллекции и забудьте

review:
A really dumb and constantly loud FPS game with super sweary dialogue, the characters speak like 13 year olds in a COD4 lobby. Most of the dialogue isn't very funny but a few jokes made me laugh pretty hard. Someone said they would kill my dick.
It's like you're trying to play an FPS game while someone is screaming "AAAAAAAAAAARRRRGGGHH!!!!" in your ear the whole time.

The combat is really fun and the skillshot system is pretty addictive. Basically you're scored on killing enemies in stylish ways. Crouch slide in to a guy then blow him in half with a shotgun, kick a guy on to a cactus, set a guy on fire then launch him in to the air and blow him to bits with gibs raining everywhere. That kind of thing.
There's only 8 different guns in the game but most of them are very cool including a triple barrelled shotgun which instantly ragdolls enemies and a cannonball launcher. 

It's also the most Unreal Engine 3 looking game ever made, if you've played Gears Of War you'll see it straight away. Every character is a jacked weight lifter and at times it really looks like you're playing a first person GOW.

It runs perfectly and looks mostly great.
Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120571262', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1699975581}
review:
Стоит ли брать игру ?
Я прошёл игру, и могу сказать что это своего рода аналог современного DOOM, где ты пытаешься месить кучу народу, которого по разнообразию вполне достаточно чтобы в основе менять свой подход к гейплею и скажу что меня зацепило в трёх словах
Первое это динамика и левел дизайн локаций, тут хватает всего по скольку локации меняться каждые 20-30 минут и ты не ходишь только по одному нудному месту и дополняет это всё каким-то разнообразием разных моментов а не только стрельбой из каких-либо пушек
Второе, почему я сказал что это похоже на DOOM, потому что тебе дают локацию, которую тебе нужно зачистить разными способами, и фишка именно этой игры, что ты можешь взаимодейсвовать с окружением которое так или иначе будет тебе помогать
И третье и лично самое главное чем именно меня игра зацепила, это цели которые даёт тебе игра помимо основого сюжета чтобы не заскучать (который здесь кстати слабоват, но юмор тут на уровне), игра даёт тебе задачу, чем лучше ты выполнишь нами поставленный челленж тем сильнее мы тебя вознаградим в очках на которые ты сможешь купить улучшения, и научиться по другому использовать своё оружие,  причём всё это дополняется всякими приписками и выглядит это эффектно считая того что игре уже как 12 лет

Итог
Если ищете  интересного геймплея и тупого юмора то берите
Если ищите глубойкий сюжет как пещера монтра из этой игры то не берите

author: {'steamid': '76561199121643996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1700162457}
review:
People Can Fly już kolejny raz pokazuje że Polska potrafi się czymś jeszcze poza Wiedźminem. Zaczęło się od Painkiller, potem Battle out of Hell(DLC) a w 2011 roku Bulletstorm. Wersja tutejsza gry to "edycja Full Clip" 
Jest wzbogacona o lepszą grafikę, ekskluzywną zawartość i tym podobne rzeczy. Przede wszystkim jest to oldschoolowy shooter w którym chodzimy, strzelamy, używamy smyczy, strzelamy rakietami, minigunem, uciekamy przed gigantycznymi okrągłymi bajerami, które chcą nas zabić. Brzmi ciekawie? To wierzchołek góry lodowej. Jest też fabuła, która swoją narracją dorównuje najlepszym filmom z Hollywood. Mieszanka futurystyki, chęć zemsty na dawnym szefo i barwne postacie, no i napakowany blondas w przeciwsłonecznych okularach i rzucający tekstami na lewo i prawo. 
Nie wiecie o kim mowa? Chodzi oczywiście o Duka, bohatera strzelanek, godnego tytułu Króla. Jako iż do tej pory nie zobaczyliśmy go w kolejnej części jego serii, dostał on występ gościnny w polskiej grze. Nic specjalnego - przechodzimy fabułę Księciem z jak zawsze genialnym Johnem St. Johnem, jego aktorem głosowym(W mojej opinii wypada on lepiej niż Grayson). Jego udział dodaje nieco humoru i narracji w stylu "Nawet nie powinno mnie tu być" lub "Tego nie było w umowie". 
Plusy gry:
- grafika
- gameplay
- narracja i fabuła
- stosunek ceny do jakości
- DLC z Dukiem
- nieszablonowość
- nowe, świeże pomysły w gatunku zdominowanym przez Call of Duty i jego skrypty
Minusy(niestety są):
- brak polskiego dubbingu(chociaż w oryginale też go nie było)
- brak możliwości skoku
- długość gry to nieco 9 godzin(jeśli wierzyć Howlongtobeat)
- niezbyt częste ale jednak są - spadki płynności
Mineło 6 lat od wydania a gra potrafi chrupnąć na mocnym kompie z RTXem na pokładzie. Są to jednak te "akceptowalne" spadki( ze 140 fps na dwie sekundy mamy 60)

Podsumowując PCF dostarcza od lat dobre gry i ta jest jak najbardziej godna polecenia. Nic tylko grać i czekać na sequel.

review:

Well boys and girls Bulletstorm is just that! Its AWESOME! and then some! This Duke version is amazing and I haven't had so much fun with a shooter since Duke-3D been released way back in 1996.

The creativity is great, kind of reminds me of Carmageddon, getting awarded points the more and better way you kill the enemy scum, the best is using the leash to pull them to you and kicking them in cacti or putting a bullet through their head but whatever way you do it, listening to Dukes smart ass comments adds that brilliant piece of humour and rugged tough guy that's missing in alot of newer shooters.

The game play, audio, graphics are spot on and the fun is endless, adding the Duke expansion is another + on something that's already a A+.

Buy it, play it and kick ass!

review:
Hi kids! Do you like violence? Do you like blood, gore, & naughty language? Bulletstorm is the game you are looking for. You take control of Grayson Hunt, and interplanetary mercenary and alcoholic that completes violent jobs for cash. Behind you, a loyal crew of warriors about as reckless and crazy as you are! Through a series of unfortunate mistakes, you become stranded on a mutant infected planet filled with savage monsters and alien creatures, all looking for a reason to tear you a new one. Kick, shoot, throw, explode, & lacerate your enemies with a variety of weapons & environmental hazards you can either avoid or use to your advantage. Cliff edges, protruding rebar, giant cacti, exploding robots, and much more can be used to reap havoc on all that stand against you. Paired with a telekinetic bracelet that gives you powers similar to Kenesis in the Dead Space franchise. You feel nearly unstoppable at times.

While the brutal & thrilling combat is the main attraction, the sideshow consists of an allstar cast of voice actors such as; Steve Blum (Tank Dempsy, Call of Duty), Jennifer Hale (Samus Aran, Metroid Prime), Andrew Kishino (Saw Gerrera, Star Wars: The Clone Wars), & Anthony De Longis (Leigh Johnson, Red Dead Redemption). The writing is vulgar, off putting, & at times too over the top, but it also helps create the hilariously chaotic experience that Bulletstorm stand out among other titles. I can highly recommendc Bulletstorm to anyone looking for a short, gritty, aggressive revenge shooter to dig into for a week or so.

review:
[h1][i]Выпей ещё, Грей, — так легче целиться![/i][/h1]
Очень достойный трэш-боевик в духе Doom,но с большим упором на сюжет.Отличная стрельба.Атмосферная заброшенная планета с абсолютно поехавшим населением для истребления игроком.Неплохой черный юмор.Море зрелищного бум-бабах-пдыщ-дыдыщ.Шикарнейшая режиссура.Огорчают губки для пуль вместо нормальных противников и отсутствие русской озвучки.Электрохлыст можно было сделать отдельным оружием вместо аналога крюка-кошки,вот это было бы эпично.Рекомендую поставить фанатскую локализацию от gamesVoice,правда,с количеством мата они несколько перегнули.Оптимизация также хромает.Игра статтерит каждые секунд 15.Скорее всего дело в кривом стриминге текстур/ассетов.Вечная проблема unreal engine.Жаль что такие игры вымерли еще в 2010-х.Хотя нет,не вымерли,просто сейчас в основном выходят бездушные конвейерные помойки,которые отнимут у тебя пол жизни,а годнота на 10-20 часов нынче колоссальная редкость.Жаль,что эта игра не получит продолжение.

TLDR,рекомендуется к прохождению,если вам начали надоедать современные игры.

review:
[h3]Normally I can't stand "modern" shooters, BUT...[/h3]

Okay, imagine you took a standard shooter game, right? This is a 2011 game, so it has all the tried and true archetypes of that era. Slow movement. Recharging health. Two-weapon limit. Mostly linear level design. All of it.

The twist?
You can sprint. You can do a super-fast slide along the ground on command.
You can kick enemies AND catch them with a laser lasso from afar, insta-ragdolling most basic mooks and letting you fling them around like [i]puppets[/i], with plenty of opportunities for synergy with your other weapons or even environmental kills of all sorts.

Not only do you get a generally faster game than the average 2010s shooter, not only do you get to screw around with enemies and get plenty of creative combos off of it, but [b]the game actively encourages and rewards you for using weird techniques in combat[/b] instead of just shooting people and ducking behind cover.
Almost every possible creative kill or combination of mechanics in the game will pop up (very arcade-y) score bonuses of all kinds, even more the more mechanics you're combining or the more kills you're getting at once with the same technique. Those points then act as your currency, which you use to get weapon upgrades and to restock on ammo and special charges.

On that note, every weapon has a CHARGE shot; those use specific special ammo that can only be restocked at checkpoints with your ponts, but they are absolutely fucking DEVASTATING. The shotgun, for instance, gets to use a piercing, super-wide wave of fire that not only oneshots most basic enemies, but [i]goes through cover[/i]. This is the kind of thing I'm talking about. The better you score, the more you'll be able to restock and use these.

Your grappling hook/lasso ALSO has a charge attack of its own too, that [i]launches every enemy in a wide radius[/i] into the air and puts them in a slow-mo status, completely vulnerable, for you to combo into basically any other weapon in your arsenal.


Granted, despite all those genuinely super fun things, you're still bound to the 2 weapon limit. The funny Halo thing.
...Except you're not, kind of.
Beating the game unlocks [b]Overkill Mode[/b], which just gives you [i]every single weapon in the game all at once[/i] and lets you freely swap between all of them with the number keys (or with just the mousewheel).
[b]This[/b] shit? THIS is what I'm talking about. You can tell they [i]knew[/i] it was more fun that way, though I'm guessing the 2-weapon limit had to have been a design mandate from higher up or something so they had to relegate this to an extra mode.
It's weird that it's locked behind beating the game once but it makes everything SO much more fun. It's ridiculous.


Really, my only gripes with this game would be [b]the writing[/b] (unbearable protagonist, mediocre 2010s story, ends on a cliffhanger for a sequel that never came) and [b]the multiplayer being dead[/b]. Seriously, like a third of the achievements in this game are locked behind that co-op mode, and I'm SURE it's plenty fun but [i]man[/i] I wish there was anyone left to play it with.


[b]Really recommending[/b] this game overall though. Even if you're the most purist of boomer shooter enthusiasts that despises Half Life and Halo with a passion, this is [i]absolutely[/i] worth a play.
Maybe on sale, don't play 40 buckarinos for this, but DEFINITELY play it at some point if you like shooters at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288981642', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1695438392}
review:
This game is surprisingly pretty good! Least, if we’re talking in the way of gameplay it’s quite a blast. Shooters rarely feel all that great when actually utilizing their gameplay but bulletstorm does it right. There’s so many unique ways to kill enemies and the gunplay feels very fresh and well done. Using the leash to whip enemies into spikes/electricity, kicking enemies off the map, sniping that has a bullet actually maneuver to how you control it like in the film Wanted. It’s all pretty fantastic and there’s a good amount of enemy variety for sure. Only real problem is there’s a distinct lack of amount of weapons and for some dumb reason you’re limited to 3 despite a weapon changing station every 2mins making it pointless not just having a scroll wheel. Also, the assault rifle is utterly useless beyond the first hour of the game and you cannot swap it out. 

My main gripe with this game comes from entirely the writing of the characters, story, and their dialogue. Jesus Christ, this dialogue is pure cringe. Homoerotic jokes, dick jokes, 5 year old humor every where and don’t get me wrong I can find this funny but it’s never ending. They’re not well written characters nor are they likable, well except Ishi but even he is so straightforward. The games overall plot is the most barebones to the point revenge story you could ever think of. What pisses me off to the highest degree though is you spend 5-6 hrs playing this game for quite honestly the biggest blue balls ending you could ever imagine. It literally makes the entire point of the game and why you played it almost null by the time you finish it. It is so unsatisfying and what’s worse is making the final moment of the game on top of this done with a QTE event too. I can’t stress how bad this ending was, it really knocked the game down a few pegs from it alone. 

All in all, it’s a decent game if you’re looking for a different kind of shooter out there with some outdated mechanics and whatnot. Just…don’t expect good writing or an ending and if you can excuse an atrocious ending I mean it’s worth a shot. It’s pretty much a mind numbing shooter where you just go around and shoot shit and have fun, the story tries its best to be compelling but it’s miserable. Still, gameplay makes this enjoyable enough so on a sale, definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069173280', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1694620991}
review:
Ah, "Bulletstorm". I remember when I first got my hands on this game. Well, to be honest, I initially pirated it. But after diving into its chaotic world and experiencing the sheer adrenaline it offered, I felt compelled to buy it on Steam to support the developers. It was that good.

At its core, "Bulletstorm" is a first-person shooter, but it's not just any shooter. It's a game that rewards creativity in combat, urging players to think outside the box with every enemy encounter. The "skillshot" system is a stroke of genius, turning every battle into a playground where you're encouraged to experiment and find the most outlandish ways to dispatch foes. Whether you're using the "Bouncer" to send enemies flying with explosive cannonballs or the "Flailgun" to tie them up with grenade-weighted bolas, the game constantly pushes you to be inventive.

The story, set in a dystopian 26th century, follows Grayson Hunt, a space pirate with a vendetta. It's a tale of revenge, betrayal, and redemption. While the narrative has its moments, it's the gameplay that truly shines. The "instinct leash" is a game-changer, allowing you to pull enemies closer or launch them into the air, setting them up for some truly epic "skillshots". And the more audacious the kill, the more points you rack up, which can be spent on weapon upgrades and ammo.

However, it's not without its flaws. The dialogue a bit too crass sometimes, and cringe other times. But these are minor gripes in what is otherwise a standout title in the FPS genre. The game did stir up some controversy, with media outlets questioning its violent content. But as with any form of entertainment, it's essential to approach it with an open mind and remember that it's just that - entertainment.

In conclusion, "Bulletstorm" is a wild ride that offers a fresh take on the FPS genre. It's a game that doesn't take itself too seriously, urging players to let loose and have fun. And in a world filled with cookie-cutter shooters, it's a breath of fresh air. If you're looking for a game that offers more than just point-and-shoot mechanics, give "Bulletstorm" a shot. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015027678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1694942720}
review:
This is a weird one. If you had asked me if you should try Bulletstorm before I replayed it again this year, I would have said yes and that it is a fun FPS without much thinking. I played the original many years back and that is how I remember it. After playing this game again now, I have changed my mind. There are too many flaws that can't be ignored and I don't know why I forgot about them. 

The game is proudly stupid and over the top. The one-liners are the most corny and clliche stuff ever and none of it is funny. A game can be dumb if it doesn't take itself too seriously. Bulletstorm does at times take itself seriously and it falls flat. The story is predictable and any twists too. It is just a back drop for the shooting. Sometimes it tried to be like Spec Ops: The Line, but it fails completely. There is no tension what so ever

There is much padding like uneccessary QTS-events and empty places that you simply run through. Sprinting with a gun is almost sickening because of the headbob and you can't turn it off. Some of the prerendered cutscenes has really low sound compared to the rest of the game and looks pretty bad. There is a lack of freedom of moment and the path you can go are restricted.

There are some good stuff. The shooting and weapons are good with decent variety. There is a skillshot system that rewards points based on how you killed an enemy. You use these points to buy upgrades and ammo. This is a fun system, even if the amount of skillshots are not unlimited and you will see many repeat. There is are some on-rails shooter segments that work well.

TLDR; Extremely dumb FPS that does some things right. I don't think it is worth to try, but some people might find some enjoyment out of this game if they can ignore the stupid stuff. If you buy, buy at a sale and only play for short bursts. This game is not suited for longer sessions since you will see the flaws faster

review: Naprawdę świetny shooter, daje mnóstwo frajdy. Fabuła bardzo płytka, na dodatek zakończenie tragiczne i zrobione tylko pod możliwość kontynuacji, w którą chętnie zagram jeśli kiedyś by się miała ukazać, jednak można by było inaczej eksplorować unikalne mechaniki, niż przedłużać fabułę, która powinna się skończyć po tych kilku, bardzo przyjemnych, godzinach rozgrywki.
